channel.title: Comments on: Twitter: Promoted Tweets in the Timeline

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/11/08/twitter-promoted-tweets-in-the-timeline/#comment-3915">Brent Logan</a>.
It seems likely that many more people are seeing that tweet through the promotion program than saw it originally. I don't follow any of the parties involved in that tweet, so I certainly wouldn't have seen it other wise.

item.title: By: Brent Logan
item.dc:creator: Brent Logan
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/11/08/twitter-promoted-tweets-in-the-timeline/#comment-3914">Joseph Scott</a>.
I understand why Twitter wants to sell this. I don't understand why Linode would pay for it. They could get the same exposure for free.

item.title: By: Brent Logan
item.dc:creator: Brent Logan
item.description: I have a hard time getting upset about this. In fact, I have a hard time understanding it. Why wouldn't Linode just RT yieldthought's tweet for free? Or time the retweeting using one of the Twitter clients that enables it?
